http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#Resource.label: Resource
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#Resource.definition: A HTTP-addressable resource whose lifecycle is managed by a LDP server.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#RDFSource.label: RDFSource
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#RDFSource.definition: A Linked Data Platform Resource (LDPR) whose state is represented as RDF.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#NonRDFSource.label: NonRDFSource
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#NonRDFSource.definition: A Linked Data Platform Resource (LDPR) whose state is NOT represented as RDF.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#Container.label: Container
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#Container.definition: A Linked Data Platform RDF Source (LDP-RS) that also conforms to additional patterns and conventions for managing membership. Readers should refer to the specification defining this ontology for the list of behaviors associated with it.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#BasicContainer.label: BasicContainer
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#BasicContainer.definition: An LDPC that uses a predefined predicate to simply link to its contained resources.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#DirectContainer.label: DirectContainer
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#DirectContainer.definition: An LDPC that is similar to a LDP-DC but it allows an indirection with the ability to list as member a resource, such as a URI representing a real-world object, that is different from the resource that is created.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#IndirectContain.label: IndirectContainer
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#IndirectContain.definition: An LDPC that has the flexibility of choosing what form the membership triples take.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#Page.label: Page
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#Page.definition: URI signifying that the resource is an in-sequence page resource, as defined by LDP Paging.  Typically used on Link rel='type' response headers.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#PageSortCriteri.label: PageSortCriterion
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#PageSortCriteri.definition: Element in the list of sorting criteria used by the server to assign container members to pages.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#hasMemberRelati.label: hasMemberRelation
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#hasMemberRelati.definition: Indicates which predicate is used in membership triples, and that the membership triple pattern is < membership-constant-URI , object-of-hasMemberRelation, member-URI >.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#isMemberOfRelat.label: isMemmberOfRelation
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#isMemberOfRelat.definition: Indicates which predicate is used in membership triples, and that the membership triple pattern is < member-URI , object-of-isMemberOfRelation, membership-constant-URI >.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#membershipResou.label: membershipResource
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#membershipResou.definition: Indicates the membership-constant-URI in a membership triple.  Depending upon the membership triple pattern a container uses, as indicated by the presence of ldp:hasMemberRelation or ldp:isMemberOfRelation, the membership-constant-URI might occupy either the subject or object position in membership triples.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#insertedContent.label: insertedContentRelation
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#insertedContent.definition: Indicates which triple in a creation request should be used as the member-URI value in the membership triple added when the creation request is successful.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#member.label: member
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#member.definition: LDP servers should use this predicate as the membership predicate if there is no obvious predicate from an application vocabulary to use.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#contains.label: contains
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#contains.definition: Links a container with resources created through the container.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#constrainedBy.label: constrainedBy
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#constrainedBy.definition: Links a resource with constraints that the server requires requests like creation and update to conform to.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSortCriteri.label: pageSortCriteria
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSortCriteri.definition: Link to the list of sorting criteria used by the server in a representation.  Typically used on Link response headers as an extension link relation URI in the rel= parameter.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSortPredica.label: pageSortPredicate
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSortPredica.definition: Predicate used to specify the order of the members across a page sequence's in-sequence page resources; it asserts nothing about the order of members in the representation of a single page.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSortOrder.label: pageSortOrder
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSortOrder.definition: The ascending/descending/etc order used to order the members across pages in a page sequence.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSortCollati.label: pageSortCollation
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSortCollati.definition: The collation used to order the members across pages in a page sequence when comparing strings.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSequence.label: Page
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#pageSequence.definition: Link to a page sequence resource, as defined by LDP Paging.  Typically used to communicate the sorting criteria used to allocate LDPC members to pages.

http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#inbox.label: inbox
http://www.w3.org/ns/ldp#inbox.definition: Links a resource to a container where notifications for the resource can be created and discovered.
